title: Awkward! Edwina Bartholomew is seated next to Seb Costello's dad Peter on a flight
text:
She recently made an 'errant Tweet' about Channel Nine reporter Seb Costello, which resulted in a legal headache for Channel Seven executives.

And while Edwina Bartholomew has apologised for the post, it can't have been the most comfortable situation for her to be sitting next to his dad on a plane last month.

According to The Daily Telegraph, Edwina was seated beside former federal treasurer Peter on a flight from Sydney to Melbourne, for Sunrise's coverage of the AFL final.

Social media storm: Edwina Bartholomew (above) was involved in a huge Twitter scandal last month, after she posted an 'errant' post about Channel Nine reporter Seb Costello

A source told the publication: 'Of all the flights going from Sydney to Melbourne on grand final weekend, can you believe it?'

Edwina is sat to have slept for the majority of the journey, before introducing herself to the chairman of Channel Nine.

'It must have been meant to happen,' the source added.

Awkward: According to sources, Channel Nine reporter Seb Costello's (left) father Peter (right) was sat with Edwina Bartholomew on a flight

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Seven and Nine for comment.

Last month, Edwina found herself in hot water over the offensive tweet about rival news reporter Seb.

In response to footage of him broadcasting from the scene of a security scare, she tweeted: 'Surprisingly articulate for a [censored]'.

Apology: According to reports, Seb received a phone call apology from Edwina - who intended to share the message privately with a friend

Edwina's post cannot be republished in Australia for legal reasons.

In a statement after the incident, Edwina explained that she was jet lagged and sleep-deprived when she posted the 'errant tweet'.

Edwina told the Herald Sun: 'I was half asleep and on the other side of the world. It was clearly a mistake and the errant tweet has been deleted.'

After this apology, she reportedly called Seb personally and left a voicemail.

According to reports, the post was intended to be a private message to a friend.
description: She recently made an 'errant Tweet' about Channel Nine reporter Seb Costello, which resulted in a legal headache for Channel Seven executives.
authors: Nicole Douglas For Daily Mail Australia
